comments.content: Sorry, I meant B is correct: etc/system/local

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct with assumption the question was for deploymentclient.conf
Answer is B, deploymentclient.conf is created in /etc/system/local

In regards to deploymentclient.conf
deploymentclient.conf for connecting to a deployment server.

Configure the universal forwarder to connect to a deployment server
From a shell or command prompt on the forwarder, run the command:
./splunk set deploy-poll <host name or ip address>:<management port>

The forwarder writes configurations for forwarding data to outputs.conf in $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/local/). See Configure forwarding with outputs.conf, for information on outputs.conf.

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Forwarder/8.2.2/Forwarder/Configuretheuniversalforwarder

Refer to here. By the way, there is no "depoymentserver.conf", only "deploymentclient.conf"

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Updating/Configuredeploymentclients

comments.content: The answer is B not C. (etc/system/local)

discussion.content:
Despite the issue in the question, the response is C
Data Admin - Slide 103

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.1/Updating/Definedeploymentclasses#Ways_to_define_server_classes
"When you use forwarder management to create a new server class, it saves the server class definition in a copy of serverclass.conf under $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/local. If, instead of using forwarder management, you decide to directly edit serverclass.conf, it is recommended that you create the serverclass.conf file in that same directory, $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/local."
B. SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/local

questions.question_text: Which of the following are valid methods to create a Splunk user? (Choose all that apply.)

choices.A: A classification that determines if a Splunk server can remotely control another Splunk server.
choices.B: A classification that determines what indexes a user can search.
choices.C: A classification that determines what capabilities a user has.
choices.D: A classification that determines what functions a Splunk server controls.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BCD needs to be the answer as even server roles are also is valid as mentioned at D

comments.content:
Roles are crucial in Splunk for defining access controls and permissions for users. 
Roles in Splunk are specific to user permission and capabilities, not server functions.

Server Role associate with service account, used to define the capabilities and permissions for the server itself, rather than indivudual users. 
BC

questions.question_text: What is a role in Splunk? (Choose all that apply.)
Which of the following describes a Splunk deployment server?

choices.C: A server that automates the deployment of Splunk Enterprise to remote servers.
choices.D: A Splunk Enterprise server that distributes apps.
choices.A: A Splunk app installed on a Splunk Enterprise server.
choices.B: A Splunk Forwarder that deploys data to multiple indexers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A Splunk deployment server is responsible for distributing configuration updates, apps, and content to other Splunk instances, such as forwarders.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: BCD
Using Duo Security with other authentication methods
You can use Duo Security with native authentication, LDAP external authentication, and scripted authentication.

Duo Security is not compatible with SAML and SSO authentication methods.
